situation: SolidJS <For> with derived arrays that recompute every tick (e.g. facts() depending on 1s timer signal) destroys/recreates DOM elements each render, resetting CSS animations mid-flip. Didn't catch this during implementation because smoke test only checked content rendering, not animation behavior.
learning: When using SolidJS <For> with arrays derived from reactive signals that update frequently, use <Index> instead (position-stable) or ensure array references are stable. Always consider animation/transition behavior when reactive data drives list rendering â€” content correctness alone isn't sufficient verification.
